item.title: Fed Stands Pat, Warns on Low Inflation (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Federal Reserve officials opted on Tuesday to keep U.S. interest rates at 1958 lows and said they expected to hold credit costs down for a considerable period out of concern inflation could drift undesirably low. The central bank's policy-setting Federal Open Market Committee, as expected, said it had left the benchmark federal funds rate at 1 percent, a 45-year low hit after the Fed cut rates 13 times since early 2001 in an effort to foster a vigorous expansion.

item.title: SEC, Massachusetts Accuse Putnam of Fraud (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Federal and state regulators on Tuesday accused Putnam Investments of securities fraud, making the mutual fund company the first to be formally charged in a widening probe into improper trading.

item.title: Kozlowski Jurors See Birthday Video Clips (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Jurors in the trial of former Tyco International Ltd. (TYC.N) Chairman Dennis Kozlowski were treated on Tuesday to a rare glimpse of one of the biggest corporate parties in recent memory -- a $2.1 million birthday celebration replete with togas, chariots and torches.

item.title: Stocks Add to Gains as Fed Holds Rates (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - U.S. stocks rose in heavy trading on Tuesday, hitting the day's highs in late afternoon, after the Federal Reserve voted to keep interest rates steady at 45-year lows, as expected.

item.title: Consumer Mood Up, Durable Goods in Demand (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - U.S. consumers, heartened by signs of an improving job market, grew more confident in October, just a month after they bought more durable goods like refrigerators, cars and washing machines, two reports showed on Tuesday.

item.title: US holds rates unchanged at 1958 low (AFP)
item.description: AFP - US Federal Reserve policymakers froze interest rates at a 1958 low for a "considerable period," vowing to beat a deflation menace even as the economy moved up a gear.

item.title: Stocks Add to Gains as Fed Holds Rates (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - U.S. stocks rose in heavy trading on Tuesday, hitting the day's highs in late afternoon, after the Federal Reserve voted to keep interest rates steady at 45-year lows, as expected.

item.title: Gilead Third-Quarter Profit Rises (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Biotechnology company Gilead Sciences Inc. (GILD.O) on Tuesday reported higher third-quarter earnings, citing strong sales of its HIV drug Viread.

item.title: SEC, Massachusetts Accuse Putnam of Fraud (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Federal and state regulators on Tuesday accused Putnam Investments of securities fraud, making the mutual fund company the first to be formally charged in a widening probe into improper trading.

item.title: Ahold Scandal to Cost $117.2 Million (AP)
item.description: AP - The billion dollar accounting scandal at global food retailer Ahold will cost the company more than euro100 million ($117.2 million) in fees for lawyers, accountants and external consultants, Ahold said Tuesday.

item.title: Taking the World by Hand (Forbes.com)
item.description: Forbes.com - Unless you're a pilot, an avid hiker or hunter, or own a car with a navigation system, you may not have noticed that one of the fastest-growing sectors in the otherwise chilly technology business is gadgets to help lost people figure out where they are.
